name: easyHotel London Victoria

reviews.text: It wasnt all bad am just saying it could be better , it has the potential but i got the feeling that they are happy just being who they are , i was treated with respect and i cant fault the staff .
reviews.title: I expected something better !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place was just a bit noisy and it shouldnt i mean it would have been so nice if you can sleep in a quiet hotel i guess thats not too much to ask . You can work on that and we will be happy not just to come by but also to recommend the place to others as well .
reviews.title: Easy Hotel as its Name!

reviews.text: The place has this amazing location and itsa good value for money honestly but just needs to be alittle bit peaceful.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you anyway i hope you consider my suggestions
reviews.title: Good value, but claustrophobic and noisy

reviews.text: I and my wife were looking for a nice hotel with a good location and thats why we picked this one but mybe we expect to much, I didnt like their cold manners from the check-in to when we check-out, rooms are not as spacious as it looks in their pictures, if I were you I would check other options. Maybe we were unlucky I dont know but I didnt feel confortable in this hotel, so I wont recommend that one, sorry.
reviews.title: London Training

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel back in july. It was a lovely experience staying there! Although I opt for the small room without window, luckily I managed to survive for 5 whole nights! Like everybody said, you got what you paid. Luckily, during my stay, I have not experience any circumstances either with the a/c, smell or anything. The staff was great! for the location, it's just 5-8 minutes walk to the victoria tube station! All in all, it's definitely a worth hotel to look out for, especially for people with tight budget. But remember to book your hotel as earlier as possible to get a better price!
reviews.title: Excellent location with lovely neighbourhood!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think everyone knows the concept of easyjet, so it should come as no surprise that the hotels follow a similar line. The rooms are small, the beds are solid plastic bases moulded to the floor and the bathroom is like a slightly bigger version of that you'd find in a caravan. There are only hooks, by way of furniture and everything like TV, aircon etc is extra.
reviews.title: Budget price and budget room, but good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, for the price (£70 for 2 nights) what do you expect in London? The room was warm. clean, not knocked around, as other places can be and the staff were very friendly, to a man. The hotel was in a great location with good cafes etc around the corner (try Garcon for breakfast) and only a walk from Buckingham Palace etc.
reviews.title: very very small rooms, but cheap & clean.

reviews.text: My wife has worked in prisons in the past and we joked it was like a cell, or some of the hostels we've stayed in abroad, but for us it was fine. We spent all our time out and about and only used the room for sleeping and to keep our stuff in, so I couldn't find any reason to complain. The design is clearly for ease of maintenance and cleaning, to keep costs down, so I didn't have a problem with it.
reviews.title: great location, friendly people

reviews.text: If you want a comfortable room for lounging about in, or a romantic weekend away, this isn't it. If you want somewhere cheap, clean and secure, this is.
reviews.title: good located and cheap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, I did book the room with no windows. The room is literally the size of the full size bed and the door swing of a normal size door. If you do not like small spaces this is not for you. It is VERY basic and I think I can find a better place for the same amount of money. But this place works if need be.
reviews.title: Sleep in a box

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff could not check us in, we had to sit at a shabby old computer in the corner of the lobby and book on the easyhotel website which crashed twice meaning we had to enter our details 3 times. We had to pay £5 extra for a remote to use the TV. When we got to the room, it was beyond small and panelled with a lurid orange plastic. The heating didn't work and we asked twice for someone to come and have a look at it - no one came and we slept in the cold. A member of staff walked in the door at 10.00 without knocking as we were getting dressed.
reviews.title: Tiny rooms, rubbish experience

reviews.text: Having said that, the room was clean. However, I have stayed at many budget hotels over the years and this was by a wide margin the worst. There are other hotels on the same road for the same price. Avoid this one.
reviews.title: rooms size as a wardrobe? nope, no that big...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small, small, tiny tiny rooms. Very clean and no awful carpet but after a few hours in the room we didn't feel comfortable...
reviews.title: MESTRE EASY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's too small and you can't move at all. Stay somewhere else (thats bigger)
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.text: 3 blocks from victoria station...biggest problem the first day was finding the street after that it was easy....clean,fun orange color accents,but no extra space in room. Staff friendly and polite. Stayed in new part lower level one night, beds and pilows seemed better. Second night in old part beds were firmer/thinner? And pillow less fluffy but maybe that was just me. But bare bones hotel....one full size bed,which was firm and ensuite bathroom,with shower and toilet. Hairdryers cost extra,internet cost extra,storage of luggage even for an hour costs extra. Also no housekeeping during your stay or it costs extra. If you are looking for great location at budget price, this is your place. With all above said, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Small hoteL good location

reviews.text: When you arrive at Victoria station head upstairs towards the food courts and turn left once you reach street level. The hotel is an easy 5-min walk and no more. I rented a lagre room with a window which was bright, clean and big enough for one person. Bathroom is a little small but OK for just 1.
reviews.title: You get what you paid for ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception area is staffed24-hrs and the location is great for eating out with good transport links. Would stay again as you get what it stays on the tin and you paid for the extra's like a TV remote which is ok I guess.
reviews.title: Small ? This word isn't enough

reviews.text: First, the positives : Incredible location (5min walk from Victoria train/bus/underground station), everything was clean, and maybe price (see above)
reviews.title: Basic Hotel

reviews.text: The problems : First, the room : we had the best price room (no window). It's SO small that it is difficult to enter the room. You cannot imagine that before seeing it. I was warned before coming, but I still was shocked ! =) Forget big suitcase or anything bigger than a backpack : it's going to be hell to store in room ! There is only 2 hooks.... and place under the bed (it's like on the floor). Then the shower/WC are like in a motorhome, but it was more or less ok for people not taller than 1.85m).
reviews.title: We expected something better!

description: The easyHotel Victoria is a 5 minute walk from Victoria Train Station, Victoria Bus and Coach Station and Victoria Underground station, giving easy access to all major tourist attractions, theatreland and the city. The hotel is 2 stops from Piccadilly Circus and 3 stops from Leicester Square and Covent Garden.The easyHotel Victoria is a short stroll from Buckingham Palace, Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey, London Eye, Trafalgar Square, Hyde Park and the Thames.A short tube or bus ride from the hotel will take you to the Tower of London, Madame Tussauds, the Natural History Museum, the Tate Modern, the Victoria & Albert Museum and the Tower of London.Shop until you drop as the hotel offers easy access to fashionable Knightsbridge, Kings Road, Bond Street and Oxford Street. Then relax and unwind at one of the many local restaurants. The area around Victoria offers great pubs, bars, a range of cuisines including some true fine dining.
